Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2010 11:54PM brunettesrule wrote: Congrats.  That's great news!.  I can remember when I slept right though as well, no so long ago.  Its awesome.  Definately turning a corner.  To long and restful nights!!!

Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2009 12:36AM brunettesrule wrote: Sanaisa, sorry to hear about the length and severity of your chemo.  I suppose I shouldn't complain.   Love and hugs to you and all the other ladies with side affects and long chemo sessions. Alot of you have worse treatments to go thru than me. I am sort of in the same boat as Lisa above.  So far (2 treatments) no side affects except a dry mouth an a bit of nausea the next day.  I can't predict future treatments, but hopefully the side affects don't worsen over the next 14 treatments, but probably will. Love and hugs to all that we get through this journey as painless as possible.

Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2009 01:01PM brunettesrule wrote: Hi Ladies I ended up in hospital last night with a temp of 38.2C (100.76F).  That sucked big time.  They took blood x-rays, urine samples, ECG readings.  They think I might possibly have an infection in or around or under my TE.  Have to go for an ultrasound tomorrow (Monday) and see if there is any fluid under the expander.  If so, they need to drain it and see if the fluid is infected.  Fingers crossed they are wrong.  I know they have to do what they have to do, but I would hate for them to have to take the expander out when I only have 2 fills to go. Anyone else had this problem? Hugs to all. Jayne

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2009 08:41PM - edited Dec 10, 2009 11:28PM by brunettesrule Hi girls Had my last AC on Tuesday (todays Friday).  Feeling ok so far. Had a big cry this morning, my eyebrows are now falling out.  I am going on holidays next Thursday (great timing hey).  I was hoping they would hang in there, at least until I returned.  How am I supposed to go swimming with drawn on eyebrows, they will wash off in the water.  I feel like a freak.  I am just so over all this cancer crap and tears.  I still have 12 weekly taxols to start in the new year.  Sorry girls, just wanted to vent and have a cry.  No matter how good eyebrow pencils are, they are still going to look drawn on.  My pedicure lady (who is asian) has had her eybrows tattooed on (no she doesn't have BC).  Maybe an idea but a bit radical.  How long before they grow back. UUURRRGGGHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!! LISA, have you still got that flag for me at the end of the finish line, I'm beginning to loose sight of it. Jayne

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2009 07:53PM brunettesrule wrote: Hi ladies I'm on holidays and I did a stupid thing.  I went to go down the water slide with my DD and as I lowered my body onto the slide, I think the weight of my body collapsed my arm and I fell onto my TE side.  OH THE PAIN - I think I now know how men feel when they get hit in the groin. Could hardly move at all last night.  A bit better this morning but if I pick up anything or do sudden movements on my TE side...pain.  Really hurts when I laugh too. Any suggestions, I think I might have sprained/strained the muscles around it?  Anyone else injured themselves lowered themselves into a bath or similar.   Jayne

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2010 10:28PM - edited Feb 18, 2010 10:29PM by brunettesrule Hi Ladies Firstly, congrats to all those who have finished their chemo and radiation...thats fantastic. I have six taxols down, six to go...so nearly there.  I have a question about the fingers.  I have only recently got numbness in my fingertips, but not pins and needles (yet?).  Is there anyway to stop the pins and needles or at least keep it to a minimum. I started working again a few weeks ago after seven months off.  So far so good, but am really buggered by the time I get home.  Would have liked more time off, but needed money desperately so had no choice but to start working again.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2009 06:39AM brunettesrule wrote: Hi all Day 8 afer Chemo #2 and luckily still no side affects so far....just probably lucky up to this point.  The little hair left on my head is starting to go.  My bowels are probably the opposite to everyone else.  Can't stop #2'ing, even when I only go for a #1, here comes #2.  They are a bit softer, but the plumbing still seems to be working (maybe a little too much... 4/5 times a day).  Considering my diet is appauling and live on a lot of junk food, but trying to eat more healthy.  Weight is dropping...yee haa.  I actually fitted into a smaller pair of jeans.  Please don't let the periods come, enjoying life without them. I went to a Look Good Feel Better course last week.  Like Lisa, I too worry about re-occurrence.  I think after I get through this, I'd hate them to find something else and have to go through it all again.  That is why I wanted a double mast, but they wouldn't do it.  I'm even to scared to have a pap smear in case its positive... Some rockstar SANAISA...lol. Being a single mum and having to give up work because of this, financially it is a hugh struggle, so my days are spend bumming around the house (because its cheap..lol) and doing a bit of private work for a friend.  I have a "day time snooze" practically every day even though I'm in bed early and wake up early.  My daughter's 12 birthday is on Saturday, so have focused on that over the last week. My rock star is my 11 year old daughter, who without her, I probably would have checked out by now permanently.  She has helped bath, dry and dress me when I came out of hospital, changed dressings and hugged me when I cried.  She loves my "haircut" and is always rubbing my head...lol.  She has matured alot since this all started, a lot to put on a 11 year olds shoulders, but she is all I have.  My family are 8 hours away by car and only talk on the phone, they give me support but are not here physically with me going through this. Seeing my OC on Monday and 4th fill on Tuesday then Chemo #3 on 28 Oct. Enough gabbing for now...I'm obviously bored...lol.   Hugs to everyone and will talk again soon. Jayne
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2009 12:59PM - edited Nov 12, 2009 01:01PM by brunettesrule Hi Ladies Long time no post.  I had my 3rd AC two weeks ago, next one and last one (YEH!) due next Wednesday.  I have been so exhausted and tired.  I stayed in bed for 5 days absolutely buggered. Then I would have a good day, then bang! buggered again, its been like that for the last two weeks. unklezwifeonty my oncologist said to paint my fingernails black as the sunlight in conjunction with the chemo (taxol) is what ruins our fingernails.  Has anyone else been told this. Its hard just to sit here and post, so this entry is short and sweet.  Catch up with you after next Wednesday. Prayers and hugs to all. Jayne
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2010 01:41PM brunettesrule wrote: Hi ladies First taxol went good, have not been sleeping well lately, must be the steriods.  My stomach is painful at night (that hungry feeling), they said the taxol will make you hungry all the time, but I don't want to eat all the time because of the chemo and gain weight, so I eat my 3 meals a day and have a hugh milk coffee before bed (i hate coffee as a rule but only have 1/4 teaspoon of coffee), it tends to semi fill my stomach and stops the hunger pains. Feeling very tired but that is probably because I have been doing a lot of cleaning and reorganising of my house this week to fit in my new lounge suite, rental inspection  and numerous medical appointments.  2nd taxol on Monday.  Got my nails done (acrylic) to stop the sunlight hitting them, nice bright purple colour. LISA, sorry to hear about your issues with rads, hopefully it won't get any worse and gets better soon. Sorry I can't comment on the rads side of things for everyone as luckily I don't need it and don't understand it...so I hope radiation is not to terrible for everyone. Jayne
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2010 01:12PM - edited Jan 21, 2010 01:12PM by brunettesrule Hi Ladies 2 taxols down, 3rd on Monday.  Feeling pretty good health wise, except for oral thrush...gross!! Will have to see Dr for script for that one, unless there is something else I can do...any suggestions?  Stomach cramps have settled down. I start working again next Wednesday after 6/7 months off.  Hopefully it won't wear me out too much. Thats great some of you are getting rid of your ports.  I never had one put in, was suggested but I wasn't real keen on it. You were all correct, these weekly taxols are coming around quite fast, it only seems like yesterday I had the first one and now I am up to my 3rd.  No signs of pins and needles yet, but it will probably rear its ugly head further down the track. My hair is growing back slowly, maybe under 1cm around the back and sides, but the front is not doing anything, maybe because of the scarf rubbing against the hair all the time? What is the BRCA test?  My exchange is due for second half of 2010...yeah!!! Will pop in again soon ladies, take care and keep well, we are all so near the finishing line. Jayne
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2010 04:26AM - edited Mar 9, 2010 07:40PM by brunettesrule unklezwifeonty I started working again 4 days a week.  My commute is 1 hour.  Seems really long at first but then you get used to it.  I look for landmarks driving home (big blue building, the river) etc and I think .... half way there, 1/4 way there, 20 mins there, next thing I'm in my driveway.  Hope the drive is not to stressful or tiring for you....just think of the money..lol. P.S.   Uggh!!! my hair has started falling out again...whats going on!!!! 2 weeks out from chemo and 1cm long ... even though it grey....bugger!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Buzz cut it really short again..looks like I'm bald from a distance.

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2009 02:01PM brunettesrule wrote: Hi Ladies After the Saturday nite emergency ward eposide - on the Monday, I went to get an ultrasound to see if there was an infection, there was not enough fluid to drain, so they admitted me into hospital Monday afternoon and got out last Friday.  Bummer hey.  My daughter was looked after by 3 friends who got her to school, back from school and looked after her during the night.  They have given me oral antibiotics to take 4 times a day for a MONTH!!!!!  I hate tablets.  Next week I have medical appointments every day - uggh!. I am feeling ok, and didn't have a temperature at all for the last week.  While in hospital, every 6 hours they pumped though the antibiotics.  I asked the Dr if I could go home and do some washing and see my daughter and come back for the next dose - he just laughed and me and said no. I thought the smooth sailing though all this since surgery couldn't continue and have to catch up with me some time.  My BC nurse, said its just a glitch and I am doing pretty well.  They cancelled my 4th and final AC last Wednesday and my 2nd last and last fill - bugger.  They expect they won't do a fill for at least a month now.  Was hoping for a decent size boob before I went on holidays mid-December.  Not sure when they are going to give me the last AC - maybe a couple of weeks and then start on the taxol next year. Hang in there everyone, we will all get through this. Jayne

Have a great time on your cruise.  I brought a swimming cap and am going to wear a hat or baseball cap when I swim.  So many parents wear hats in the pools when they swim...sun smart!. Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2010 12:36PM - edited Jan 11, 2010 12:41PM by brunettesrule Hi Ladies First taxol went ok yesterday.  Feel quite normal and not sick this morning...so far.  Had a bit of a restless night waking up or being awake every 2 hours due to steriods they gave me.  The OC nurse suggested sleeping pills, but they are pumping enough drugs into me..don't really want to put anymore into my body.  Seeing I'm not working at the moment, I can snooze during the day for catch-up sleep. So, 1 down...11 to go - Last Monday in March will be number 12.  Hurray. Was very teary when I got home.  It's been 4 weeks since last chemo due to xmas break and I sort of got use to feeling "normal" again with no Dr's appointments or chemo, then having to start stage 2 of chemo got me all upset again.  Just wish it was all over and I can get back into life again.  I can see a dim light at the end of the tunnel.   Have an appt with PS today, and local doctor tomorrow. I splashed out and brought myself a new lounge suite which is being delivered on Thursday, really couldn't afford it but I thought what the hell, I deserve something nice that I have wanted for over a year now..can't wait to sit on it...lol. Hope everyone is doing ok and nearing the finishing line.  Hurray, we are all going to get through this. Jayne
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2009 11:02PM brunettesrule wrote: Hi Ladies Had my 3rd fill on Tuesday and had my 3rd chemo treatment yesterday (7 Oct).  What a disaster of a day that was. My appt was 10.00am, got there at 9.30am.  Was called into the room at 11.15am.  They put the canula into the top of my hand, then decided it was no good - so had to take it out.  Then stuck it in the back of my forearm...ouch both times.  Then they dripped saline through.  After one hour I asked the nurse why its going through so slowly and she said my chemo was not ready yet.  At 3.15pm (6 hours later) they started the chemo treatment on me...so I was less than impressed at the time they started.  We had a public holiday on the Monday here in Australia, so they were trying to fit all the Monday appts in during the rest of the week. They put the Droxorubisin (sorry if incorrectly spelt)  in and then started the drip.  I said to her that I haven't been given my anti-nausea tablets yet, she checked the chart and said really you are supposed to have them one hour before treatment..GREAT!  So she gave me one pill and injected me with anti-nausea liquid.  I left the ward at 4.15pm and very annoyed. I understand they were doing their best and were very busy, but no-one had read by blood test, thats whey the chemo was so late.  I did my part on the Tuesday and had my blood test at 8.30am so it would make the 10.00am courier to the lab and then be faxed to the hospital in sufficient time. Next time there is a public holiday, either I will cancel my treatment for that week or arrive 5 hours late.  The charge in my ipod ran out and I had no-one to talk to and was sarving for food and a ciggy. Some lessons learned.  Next time take my laptop and a packed lunch. My veins are not easy to find anymore..they suggested I may need a port after a couple of more treatments....does that hurt..one lady near me had her port about the inside of her elbow..weird place to put it thought.

Maybe I should go to the hospital and have an ultrasound? Jayne

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2009 02:25PM brunettesrule wrote: Hi Ladies. I had my first chemo of AC on 17 Sept.  Except for a bit of nausea on the Thursday morning until lunch time, there has been no sick feel or tiredness so far.  My mouth is really dry though.  Had my second fill yesterday (22nd) and have a nice little boob forming - need about another 4 fills. I have another 3 x treatments of AC (Doxorubicin and Cyclophosphamide) then I have a weekly treatment for 12 weeks of (not sure which drug they are giving me).  Luckily I don't need radiation after my right mast as it wasn't close to the chest wall. So, so far so good with the chemo and side affects.  I sure the side affects will increase as I go through more treatments. Good luck to everyone in September and beyond with their chemo and stay strong..we can all beat this and come out the other side.

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2010 05:30AM - edited Mar 1, 2010 05:31AM by brunettesrule Hi Ladies  Lisa thats great that your port is out, and lost weight to boot!!! yeah!  I have some great news myself, they took me off chemo today.  Apparently the side affects (pins and needs in fingers and toes, severe aching legs and nose bleeds) are getting bad, so the Oncologist told me thats my bodies way of saying I have had enough.  I am SOOOOOO HAPPPY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Going out to dinner with my daughter tonight to celebrate.  He said the 5 remaining taxols would have made minimal difference to having them to not having them. I get to pick out which impant I need on March 17 and see oncologist on March 18 about going on tablets for the next 5 years.  Apparently my cancer was estergine based. Now my body can start getting back to normal.   I am over the moon. Hope everyone is feeling good and nearing completion.  I will check in again on March 19 or thereabouts.  Jayne

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2010 01:09AM - edited Mar 18, 2010 01:11AM by brunettesrule Hi girls I saw my PS yesterday, date for exchange is August 16 (yeah! only 5 months away) - that will make it 1 year and 10 days after my mastecomy...wow, hasn't time flown, just seems like surgery was yesterday. See my OC today about tables for next 5 years...ugghh!. Loosing weight dramatically now..but I've been told its all the fluid that was stored during chemo..hopefully there is 30kg of water...lol.  Down to 87kg (was 99kg at surgery). Hair growth not doing alot...3 weeks out from chemo...I'm not very patient...lol I feel a little out of place here now, as all you ladies are having radiation and I don't need it or know anything about it, but I wish you all the luck and healing in the world to get through radiation. I suppose I should jump to another thread for exchanges coming up, but I will feel strange starting in another thread after I have talked to you guys for 7 months. Love and hugs to all and good healing. Jayne

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2010 12:44AM brunettesrule wrote: @Marie K  ... I have never trimmed my hair, its only 1/4 inch long but very very thick, which may make it look like a ton of hair.  I trimed it myself with my "nether-regions" trimmer...lol - no use for it down there either...lol.   The first colour i put in was a temporary 8 wash colour which turned purple after it faded.  Then I put in a permanent light brown and got this colour.  I went to a busy major shopping centre today with my "new hair" - a big step with such short hair.  Jayne
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2010 11:06PM - edited Apr 24, 2010 02:43AM by brunettesrule Hi Ladies, I have a bit of a problem. I am 9 wks post chemo and my hair has now covered my head (very thickly I might add) but is very short and very very grey.  I had brown hair before all this but needed to cover greys once a month.  Seeing "I now have hair" but grey I put a brown  temporary (8 wash) dye on my hair.  It turned the hair purple after the brown started to fade.  I thought even though I only have a bit of hair - brown might look better than grey.  Couldn't handle the purple anymore so put a permanent colour in (light brown), now my hair has turned a auburn/brown, very reddish.  I am very temped to shave the whole lot off and start again.  I look like an idiot.  I still wear scarves when I go out.  Hair not long enough yet, but will be soon if I let it grow.  Question, is the weird colours due to chemo still in my hair or the new regrowth is that grey that it is not taking the colour.  Should I "buzz" cut it down and start again or wait for it to grow and cut it out bit by bit.  I have reconstructive surgery in August and was hoping to be able to go coverless by then and a nice shade of brown.

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2009 08:06AM - edited Jul 23, 2009 08:17AM by brunettesrule Thanks everyone.  I'll clear somethings up for you.  Being in Australia, it might be a bit different to USA.   Been diagnoised with a 5cm lump in my right breast.  My biopsy pathology says NST (no specific type) carcinoma and DCIS.  Due for surgery Aug 6.  I have no choice but to have a mast because the cancer is so big 12 o'clock position.  I have not been given the option of a bilateral mastectomy and don't know what it is..will google later.  Not sure why this is not an option.  You tend to go with what the surgeon suggests..they know more than me. The breast care nurse said I might be stage 2...don't know for sure. I have three choices before my PS can get to me....no breast, prosthesis or TE.  I have chosen the TE (which I know makes way for an implant, but I may decide later on to have a TRAM flap - as this is 2 years away, I will decide later).  My PS says the TE is unnecessary if I have the TRAM Flap, I understand this, but I need to concentrate on surgery's now...not in 2 years.  I don't want a prosthesis for 2 years and I don't want nothing for 2 years so TE is all that is left.  I will need 4-6 bouts of chemo and possibly rad (they are not sure on that yet - maybe they are waiting till after the surgery when they know more about the cancer to decide whether I need it).   In six months time (approx) the PS is doing a reduction of my left breast (non ca) from DD to C, because they cannot fill to DD and I don't want my big boobs back.  That means a total of 3 surgerys - minimum...wow a lot to deal with. My big decision (which I can't decide) is the lymp nodes.  I am having a sentinal node biopsy the day before the surgery.  That is how far I have gotten so far with all this.  Standard procedure for this size of lump is an auxillary clearance or I can be part of a SNAC2 trial in Australia in which a computer decides for me and I either get chosen for an auxillary clearance or they check the sentinal node.  Really don't want either.  Would prefer sentinal node checked first, surgeon says I can do it but standard procedure is auxillary clearance.  So confused.  I need to decide next Thursday, should have decided yesterday but all I could do is cry because I don't now what to do.  I don't want them to take out healthy nodes and run the risk of lympdomea if they are not cancerous but the back of my mind says to take all the crap out of my body..l don't want it. So that is where I am at.  I have resigned from work to give myself a year or so off to recover and get through all this treatment.  Some people think I was crazy to resign, but after being a single parent for the last 7 years and working that whole time... I think I am entitled to some time off for myself for my treatment.  When I am all well, I will go back to work. Hopefully I am understanding this all properly..its a lot to take in. With the lump being 5cm..surgeon says there is 73% chance of cancer under the armpit, but also 27% not...that is why I cannot decide.  Really need some help here. Glad I found this site..very helpful talking to people who are or have gone through what I am going through.  God bless all of you and keep you healthy.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed..decisions to be made ...help brunettesrule jezza

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2010 02:39PM - edited Mar 9, 2010 02:40PM by brunettesrule I go bald at home, but if someone knocks on the door, I immediately throw on a scarf I keep near the door.  My first scarf I brought from Katies..$35 and not hemmed...what a rip off.  I cut it in two and use it when I swim in the pool in my townhouse complex..they are a bit ratty now. I brought a heat resistant wig which looks great..people I have told its a wig told me they never would have guessed it was a wig. I have several scarfs now..brought material from spotlight or material store in 1 metre squares and use them...so much cheaper...I got 4 scarves for $20... I saw a sale for $5 per metre..great. I have never worn a hat...not a hat person, but as summer draws to a close here in Australia, I might have to thing of something for winter..doubt whether I will have enough hair not to wear anything. The only beanie I have is my daughters BRIGHT PINK one..would not wear that out in public..lol. I love wearing the scarves with the long ties down the back.. I know wear the knot below my ear and have the ties run over my mast. side. The other day I was in the shopping centre all dressed in my black work uniform with black scarf (looked like the mafia....lol) and this woman kept staring at me...I mean really staring...I walked past her down the isle and when I got to the end I turned around and she was still staring.  Gave me the shits so I walked back to her and said "I hope you never get breast cancer and people stare at you". She got very embarrased and walked away.  Geez I felt good after it.  I work in a suburb where there is a lot of muslim women who all wear scarfs, so I don't know why she was staring at me.  Maybe I should not have been so mean, but sometimes it bugs me that people 'stare'.  Sorry for the vent at the end. Jayne
Posts.Title: What was your favorite head covering through chemo? BooBee Brendatrue
